answers.answer: You make reference to many tests, not too sure of which sort?  It sounds like this has happened a few months ago?  How is he doing now?  If things haven't  improvedmaybe you need to look deeper into causes, do some research?  I would expect he was tested for issues such heart etc.

question: Follow up of last question:http://www.medhelp.org/posts/Undiagnosed-Symptoms/Sudden-serious-numbness-of-the-left-half-of-the-body/show/1329945?personal_page_id=1985146#post_6079703We went to the emergency room at the UCLA Medical Center a few months ago. They did many x-ray and tests and they all came out normal. Since his numbness passed over within hours, they sent him home. He doesn't have diabetes, high blood pressure, or anything bad/abnormal. We went to the neurologist, as well, and again nothing that is abnormal is found. What should we do now? Are there any particular experts that we should see?This discussion is related to/posts/show/1329945.
title: Sudden Extreme Numbness on the Left Side of the Body
